etymology.description: 大同(大同) (dàtóng, "Great Unity") is a Confucian utopian ideal from the Book of Rites (禮記/礼记), and 區(區) (qū, "district") refers to an administrative division.
etymology.interpretation: The term 大同區 (大同區) (dàtóng qū, "Datong District") is named after a philosophical concept emphasizing harmony and unity. It symbolizes the aspiration for a harmonious community within the administrative area.

examples.chinese: 大同区(大同區)历史悠久(歷史悠久)，街道繁华(街道繁華)。
examples.pinyin: Dàtóng Qū lìshǐ yōujiǔ, jiēdào fánhuá.
examples.english: Datong District has a long history, and its streets are bustling.

examples.chinese: 大同区(大同區)保留传统(保留傳統)，吸引游客(吸引遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Dàtóng Qū bǎoliú chuántǒng, xīyǐn yóukè.
examples.english: Datong District preserves traditions and attracts tourists.
